alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 09 at 1:20AM PDT until May 09 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet on west facing beaches. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, since they can be deadly locations in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
